methods.name: public Builder setClip(@NonNull ClipData clip)
methods.comment:
* Sets the data to be inserted.
         * @param clip The data to insert.
         * @return this builder

methods.name: public Builder setSource(@Source int source)
methods.comment:
* Sets the source of the operation.
         * @param source The source of the operation. See {@code SOURCE_} constants.
         * @return this builder

methods.name: public Builder setFlags(@Flags int flags)
methods.comment:
* Sets flags that control content insertion behavior.
         * @param flags Optional flags to configure the insertion behavior. Use 0 for default
         *              behavior. See {@code FLAG_} constants.
         * @return this builder

methods.name: public Builder setLinkUri(@Nullable Uri linkUri)
methods.comment:
* Sets the http/https URI for the content. See
         * {@link android.view.inputmethod.InputContentInfo#getLinkUri} for more info.
         * @param linkUri Optional http/https URI for the content.
         * @return this builder

methods.name: public Builder setExtras(@SuppressLint("NullableCollection") @Nullable Bundle extras)
methods.comment:
* Sets additional metadata.
         * @param extras Optional bundle with additional metadata.
         * @return this builder

methods.name: public Builder setInputContentInfo(@Nullable InputContentInfo inputContentInfo)
methods.comment:
* Set the {@link InputContentInfo} object if the content is coming from the IME. This can
         * be used for proactive cleanup of permissions.
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public Builder setDragAndDropPermissions(@Nullable DragAndDropPermissions permissions)
methods.comment:
* Set the {@link DragAndDropPermissions} object if the content is coming via drag-and-drop.
         * This can be used for proactive cleanup of permissions.
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public ContentInfo build()
methods.comment: * @return A new {@link ContentInfo} instance with the data from this builder.
